title: Alfred Grimhand's Barcrawl

properties.value: Alfred Grimhand's Barcrawl is a miniquest that is required to be completed in order to gain access to the Horror from the Deep and Scorpion Catcher quests, and access to the Barbarian Outpost Agility course, where it is considered a "rite of passage". To complete it, you must trek around various bars and pubs in Old School RuneScape, drinking a specialty drink, having them sign off a supplied Barcrawl card.

The wiki defaults to the British convention for floor numbering: Ground floor, first floor, etc. This may be changed by clicking the moon icon at the top right of the site.
This miniquest has a quick guide found here.
It briefly summarises the steps needed to complete the quest.
Alfred Grimhand's Barcrawl
Released 25 March 2002 (Update)
Members Yes
Quest series None
Developer(s) Andrew Gower

Alfred Grimhand's Barcrawl is a miniquest that is required to be completed in order to gain access to the Horror from the Deep and Scorpion Catcher quests, and access to the Barbarian Outpost Agility course, where it is considered a "rite of passage". To complete it, you must trek around various bars and pubs in Old School RuneScape, drinking a specialty drink, having them sign off a supplied Barcrawl card.

Contents

  • 1 Details
  • 2 Walkthrough
    • 2.1 Starting out
    • 2.2 Visiting the bars
    • 2.3 Possible routes
      • 2.3.1 Alternative routes
        • 2.3.1.1 Low magic/few teleports
        • 2.3.1.2 Low cost/low magic/shortest walking distances
        • 2.3.1.3 Utilising gnomes' transportation
  • 3 Rewards
  • 4 Required for completing
  • 5 Trivia

Details[edit | edit source]

Start point Speak to the Barbarian Guard at the entrance of the Barbarian Agility Training Course.
Official difficultyNovice
DescriptionGo to bars and buy alcohol.
Official lengthMedium
Requirements None
Items required
  • 208 coins to buy all the required alcohol
Recommended
  • Restore potions to restore skills that are lowered
  • Food to recover any lost hitpoints
  • Stamina or energy potions
  • Fast travel to several locations
    • Barbarian Outpost (Games Necklace)
    • Varrock (Varrock teleport, Chronicle or Combat Bracelet to the Champions' Guild)
    • Lumberyard (Lumberyard teleport, Digsite pendant or Digsite teleport)
    • Tree Gnome Stronghold (Balloon Transport System, Gnome Glider, Spirit Tree or Slayer Ring to the Slayer Cave)
    • Brimhaven (Brimhaven teleport, Teleport to House if your house is in Brimhaven, or ship from Ardougne)
    • Musa Point (Amulet of Glory to Karamja or ship from Port Sarim)
    • Port Sarim (Explorer's Ring 2, Amulet of Glory to Draynor Village or Rat Pits minigame teleport)
    • Yanille (Watchtower teleport or Nightmare Zone minigame teleport)
    • Ardougne (Ardougne teleport or Ardougne cloak)
    • Falador (Falador teleport)
    • Seers' Village (Camelot teleport or Combat Bracelet to the Ranging Guild)
Enemies to defeat None
{"requirements":"None","desc":"Go to bars and buy alcohol.","difficulty":"Novice","kills":"None","name":"Alfred Grimhand's Barcrawl","start":"Speak to the Barbarian Guard at the entrance of the Barbarian Agility Training Course.","length":"Medium","items":"*208 [[coins]] to buy all the required alcohol"}

Walkthrough[edit | edit source]

Starting out[edit | edit source]

To begin, talk to one of the barbarian guards outside the Agility training area at the Barbarian Outpost (Games necklace) to get the Barcrawl card. If your inventory is full, the guard will make no mention of the miniquest and you will not receive the card. While doing the bar crawl, you'll be given a card with a list of all the bars you have to visit. Each one will be checked off when you've found it and drunk the specific brew required. If you lose the card, you'll have to start the entire miniquest all over again.

You'll need to tell the barkeepers that you're doing the Alfred Grimhand Barcrawl and they will give you what you need. The brews are very strong, though, causing some damage as well as some steep temporary drops in stats. The entire trip will cost around 230 coins, plus money for runes/tablets and boat trips to Karamja. Once you have every line of the card signed, return it to one of the guards at the Barbarian Outpost.

Visiting the bars[edit | edit source]

You can visit the bars in any order. The amount of damage dealt by the damaging drinks is dependent on your Hitpoints level. For the possible routes, check out the section after the table below. Note that a very cost efficient way to get around is by going on to a house party world (World 330 for example) to use the teleports and the jewellery boxes provided by the hosts.

Bar Location Drink Name Cost (Coins) Effects Map
Blue Moon Inn South-central Varrock Uncle Humphrey's Gutrot 50 Lowers Attack, Defence, Strength, Smithing and Hitpoints. Makes you say, "Blearrgh!"
Blurberry Bar 1st floor[UK]2nd floor[US] of the Grand Tree, south-eastern corner (west of Heckel Funch's grocery/liquor store. Talk to Blurberry, not 'The Barman') Fire Toad Blast 10 Lowers health.
Dead Man's Chest Brimhaven (south-west of Brimhaven Agility Arena) Supergrog 15 Lowers Attack, Defence, Herblore, Cooking and Prayer. Causes double vision.
Dragon Inn Yanille Fire Brandy 12 Lowers Attack and Defence. Blurs vision.
Flying Horse Inn Ardougne (north of Ardougne Castle) Heart Stopper 8 Lowers health by about 20-30% of your total. Makes your eyes water.
Forester's Arms Seers' Village (between the pillory and the anvil room) Liverbane Ale 18 Lowers Attack, Defence, Fletching, Firemaking, and Woodcutting. Causes dizziness.
Jolly Boar Inn Varrock (next to the Lumber Yard) Olde Suspiciouse 10 Lowers Attack, Defence, Mining, Crafting, and Magic. Makes your head spin.
Karamja Spirits Bar Musa Point Ape Bite Liqueur 7
Rising Sun Falador Hand of Death Cocktail 70 Lowers Attack, Defence, Ranged, and Fishing. Lowers health. Makes the screen shake slightly for between 2–5 seconds.
Rusty Anchor Port Sarim Black Skull Ale 8 Blurs vision. Causes hiccups.

Possible routes[edit | edit source]

  • The Forester's Arms - Teleport to Camelot and head west to Seers' Village.
  • The Blurberry Bar - If Tree Gnome Village has been completed, teleport to Grand Exchange and use the spirit tree to teleport directly to the Tree Gnome Stronghold. Alternatively, the Amulet of glory or the Duel Arena teleport can be used to teleport to Al Kharid and then a gnome glider can be used to get to the Tree Gnome Stronghold after completing The Grand Tree quest. It's also possible to use a Grand seed pod - note that this is not recommended due to the price of the pod. Alternatively, you can use a Fishing guild teleport and run West. After reaching the Tree Gnome Stronghold, go to the 1st floor[UK]2nd floor[US] of the Grand Tree, and get the drink from Blurberry at the Blurberry Bar.
  • The Jolly Boar Inn - A Lumberyard teleport is the quickest way. If the gnome gliders can be used, you can take the glider to Varrock and walk north-west. Alternatively, you can use a Digsite Pendant or Digsite Teleport and walk north-west. You can also teleport to Varrock, head east outside of the city, and then straight north to the bar. If using the spirit trees, teleport back to the Grand Exchange and either use the north-west agility shortcut (21 Agility required) and run east along the Wilderness border. With 50 and access to the Balloon transport system, you could alternatively teleport to Castle Wars and pay Willow logs to get to the Lumber Yard.
  • The Blue Moon Inn - Use a Varrock teleport, the Chronicle or walk back to the southern end of Varrock.
  • The Flying Horse Inn - The Rat Pits of Ardougne (run by Jimmy Dazzler) are next to the pub - if possible, you can teleport using the minigame teleport. Alternatively, use a Skills Necklace to teleport to the Fishing Guild, Teleport to Ardougne, take Captain Barnaby's boat from Rimmington or use the spirit tree in the Gnome Stronghold to teleport to the Khazard battlefield, and then proceed to the north-western part of East Ardougne.
  • The Dragon Inn - Use a Watchtower Teleport, teleport to house in Yanille, teleport to Castle Wars, use fairy ring code ciq, or the minigame teleport to the Nightmare Zone and walk south-west from there to Yanille. The bar is at the southwestern part of the city.
  • The Rising Sun Inn - Teleport to Falador. The bar is south-west of the teleport spot.
  • The Rusty Anchor - Use an amulet of glory to teleport to Draynor Village and walk west to Port Sarim, use the Rat Pits minigame teleport to get to Port Sarim, use the Pest Control minigame teleport and run north and travel with the squire to get to Port Sarim, if your house is in Rimmington, teleport to house and run east to Port Sarim, or simply walk south from Falador to Port Sarim and proceed to the most north-eastern building in Port Sarim.
  • The Karamja Spirits Bar - Take a ship to Musa Point from Port Sarim or glory teleport to Karamja.
  • Take the charter ship to Brimhaven, take the boat from Rimmington or go to Musa Point and walk past the volcano, getting the drink from the Dead Man's Chest.
  • Return to the Barbarian Outpost, preferably by using a games necklace.

Alternative routes[edit | edit source]

Low magic/few teleports[edit | edit source]
  • Run to the Tree Gnome Stronghold, go to the 1st floor[UK]2nd floor[US] of the Grand Tree, and get the drink from Blurberry Bar.
  • Go to Ardougne, then proceed to the Flying Horse Inn, located in the western side of East Ardougne.
  • Travel south to Yanille. Buy a drink from the bar at the south-western part of the city.
  • Go to Varrock and visit the Blue Moon Inn.
  • Proceed north-east in Varrock to the Jolly Boar Inn. It is just west of the Lumber Yard.
  • Go to Falador and then go to the Rising Sun Inn.
  • Walk to Port Sarim, and proceed to the Rusty Anchor.
  • Take the ship to Musa Point and visit the Karamja Spirits Bar.
  • Take the charter ship to Brimhaven, or simply run west over the volcano, getting the drink from the Dead Man's Chest.
  • Now take the charter ship for 480 coins to Catherby then go to Seers' Village, and then visit the Forester's Arms.
  • Return to the Barbarian Outpost, preferably by using a games necklace.
Low cost/low magic/shortest walking distances[edit | edit source]

Required:

  • Extra coins for transportation
  • A games necklace
  • A Dramen staff or better for Fairy Ring teleportation
  • Unlocked Balloon transport system to Falador and Varrock
  • Start in Seers' Village (walk or teleport there), and visit the Forester's Arms.
  • Take the Sinclair Mansion fairy ring to Yanille (ciq). Buy a drink from the bar at the south-western part of the city.
  • Run back to the fairy ring, travel to the Grand Exchange (dkr) and climb the Spirit Tree to the Tree Gnome Stronghold, go to the 1st floor[UK]2nd floor[US] of the Grand Tree, and get the drink from Blurberry Bar.
  • Climb the Spirit Tree again to the Khazard Battlefield and run north to the Flying Horse Inn, located in the western side of East Ardougne.
  • Take the ship to Brimhaven, getting the drink from the Dead Man's Chest.
  • Walk to Musa Point and visit the Karamja Spirits Bar.
  • Take the ship to Port Sarim, and proceed to the Rusty Anchor.
  • Run north (or teleport) to Falador and then go to the Rising Sun Inn. This is probably the longest distance to run after Seers' Village, you can consider to teleport.
  • Run south (by first taking the Crumbling Wall on the West, or going underneath in the south) and take the balloon to Varrock and walk to the Jolly Boar Inn.
  • Run south and visit the Blue Moon Inn.
  • Return to the Barbarian Outpost, preferably by using a games necklace.
Utilising gnomes' transportation[edit | edit source]

Required:

  • Extra coins for transportation
  • Access to spirit trees and gnome gliders
  • Easy access to a spirit tree (e.g. Ardougne cloak)
  • Start in the Tree Gnome Stronghold and go to the 1st floor[UK]2nd floor[US] of the Grand Tree to get the drink from Blurberry Bar.
  • Take the gnome glider to Lemanto Andra and walk northwest to the Jolly Boar Inn.
  • Walk around to the Blue Moon Inn in South Varrock.
  • Take the spirit tree from the Grand Exchange to Khazard Battlefield to the Flying Horse Inn.
  • Take the charter ship to Brimhaven and get wasted at the Dead Man's Chest.
  • Run east to the Karamja Spirits Bar at Musa Point.
    • If you haven't done Pirate's Treasure yet, now's a good time to smuggle your Karamjan rum over.
  • Take the ship to Port Sarim and go north to the Rusty Anchor Inn.
  • From then, go north into Falador and visit the Rising Sun Inn.
  • Take a spirit tree to Tree Gnome Village and leave the maze via Elkoy. Run south and then east to get to Yanille's Dragon Inn.
    • Players who have access to the Nightmare Zone can use the minigame teleport instead, and also pop in and out of a practice instance to restore run energy.
  • Take the charter ship from Port Khazard, a little north east of Yanille, to Catherby, and run to Seer's Village to visit the Forester's Arms.
  • Return to the Barbarian Outpost, either by running west, using a Games Necklace, or taking the minigame teleport to Barbarian Assault.

Rewards[edit | edit source]

Upon completion of the miniquest, players will now be able to access the Barbarian Outpost Agility Course, which is required to enter during Scorpion Catcher and Horror from the Deep. In addition, players can speak to the barbarian guard to learn how to automatically smash empty vials upon drinking the last dose of a potion.

Required for completing[edit | edit source]

Completion of Alfred Grimhand's Barcrawl is required for the following:

  • Horror from the Deep
  • Medium Kandarin Diary
  • Scorpion Catcher

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • After completing all bar crawl locations, you will be unable to read the bar crawl card as you will be "too drunk."
  • After drinking in Brimhaven, it says you think you see two bartenders signing two barcrawl cards.
  • After drinking at the Falador pub, your screen will sway slightly to indicate you are drunk.
  • None of the drinks appear in a player's inventory but are drunk automatically.
  • After you hand the bar crawl card to the guard, he says that he never learned to read, he just sees you are plenty drunk and lets you go to the agility course.
  • It is possible to redo the miniquest by drop-tricking to make a duplicate and, before completing the quest, dropping it again. To start it again, the player must go to one of the bars; however, they will be unable to enter the agility course until they complete it again.

'''Alfred Grimhand's Barcrawl''' is a [[miniquest]] that is required to be completed in order to gain access to the [[Horror from the Deep]] and [[Scorpion Catcher]] [[quests]], and access to the [[Barbarian Outpost]] [[Agility course]], where it is considered a "rite of passage". To complete it, you must trek around various [[Bar (location)|bars and pubs]] in ''Old School RuneScape'', drinking a specialty drink, having them sign off a supplied [[Barcrawl card]].

==Details==
{{Quest details

**Varrock ([[Varrock teleport]], [[Chronicle]] or [[Combat Bracelet]] to the Champions' Guild)
**Lumberyard ([[Lumberyard teleport]], [[Digsite pendant]] or [[Digsite teleport]])
**Tree Gnome Stronghold ([[Balloon Transport System]], [[Gnome Glider]], [[Spirit Tree]] or [[Slayer Ring]] to the Slayer Cave)
**Brimhaven ([[Brimhaven teleport]], [[Teleport to House]] if your house is in Brimhaven, or ship from [[Ardougne]])
**Musa Point ([[Amulet of Glory]] to Karamja or ship from [[Port Sarim]])
**Port Sarim ([[Explorer's Ring 2]], [[Amulet of Glory]] to Draynor Village or [[Rat Pits]] [[minigame]] teleport)
**Yanille ([[Watchtower teleport]] or [[Nightmare Zone]] [[minigame]] teleport)
**Ardougne ([[Ardougne teleport]] or [[Ardougne cloak]])
**Falador ([[Falador teleport]])
**Seers' Village ([[Camelot teleport]] or [[Combat Bracelet]] to the Ranging Guild)
}}

==Walkthrough==
===Starting out===
To begin, talk to one of the barbarian guards outside the [[Agility]] training area at the [[Barbarian Outpost]] (Games necklace) to get the [[Barcrawl card]]. If your inventory is full, the guard will make no mention of the miniquest and you '''will not receive the card'''. While doing the bar crawl, you'll be given a card with a list of all the bars you have to visit. Each one will be checked off when you've found it and drunk the specific brew required. If you lose the card, you'll have to start the entire miniquest all over again.

You'll need to tell the barkeepers that you're doing the Alfred Grimhand Barcrawl and they will give you what you need. The brews are very strong, though, causing some damage as well as some steep temporary drops in stats. The entire trip will cost around 230 coins, plus money for [[runes]]/[[teleport tablet|tablets]] and boat trips to [[Karamja]]. Once you have every line of the card signed, return it to one of the guards at the Barbarian Outpost.

===Visiting the bars===
You can visit the bars in any order. The amount of damage dealt by the damaging drinks is dependent on your [[Hitpoints]] level. For the possible routes, check out the section after the table below. Note that a very cost efficient way to get around is by going on to a house party world (World 330 for example) to use the teleports and the [[jewellery box]]es provided by the hosts.

===Possible routes===
{{Checklist|
*The [[Forester's Arms]] - Teleport to Camelot and head west to [[Seers' Village]].
*The [[Blurberry Bar]] -  If [[Tree Gnome Village]] has been completed, teleport to Grand Exchange and use the [[spirit tree]] to teleport directly to the [[Tree Gnome Stronghold]]. Alternatively, the [[Amulet of glory]] or the [[Ring of dueling|Duel Arena teleport]] can be used to teleport to [[Al Kharid]] and then a [[gnome glider]] can be used to get to the [[Tree Gnome Stronghold]] after completing [[The Grand Tree]] quest. It's also possible to use a [[Grand seed pod]] - note that this is not recommended due to the price of the pod. Alternatively, you can use a [[Skills Necklace|Fishing guild teleport]] and run West. After reaching the Tree Gnome Stronghold, go to the {{FloorNumber|uk=1}} of the [[Grand Tree]], and get the drink from [[Blurberry]] at the [[Blurberry Bar]].
*The [[Jolly Boar Inn]] - A [[Lumberyard teleport]] is the quickest way. If the [[gnome glider]]s can be used, you can take the glider to Varrock and walk north-west. Alternatively, you can use a [[Digsite Pendant]] or [[Digsite Teleport]] and walk north-west. You can also teleport to Varrock, head east outside of the city, and then straight north to the bar. If using the spirit trees, teleport back to the Grand Exchange and either use the north-west agility [[shortcut]] (21 Agility required) and run east along the [[Wilderness]] border. With {{SCP|Firemaking|50}} and access to the [[Balloon transport system]], you could alternatively teleport to [[Castle Wars]] and pay [[Willow logs]] to get to the Lumber Yard.
*The [[Blue Moon Inn]] - Use a [[Varrock teleport]], the [[Chronicle]] or walk back to the southern end of Varrock.
*The [[Flying Horse Inn]] -  The [[Rat Pits]] of [[Ardougne]] (run by [[Jimmy Dazzler]]) are next to the pub - if possible, you can teleport using the minigame teleport. Alternatively, use a [[Skills Necklace]] to teleport to the Fishing Guild, Teleport to [[Ardougne]], take [[Captain Barnaby]]'s boat from [[Rimmington]] or use the spirit tree in the Gnome Stronghold to teleport to the [[Khazard battlefield]], and then proceed to the north-western part of East Ardougne.
* The [[Dragon Inn]] - Use a [[Watchtower Teleport]], [[Teleport to House|teleport to house]] in Yanille, teleport to Castle Wars, use fairy ring code {{fairycode|ciq}}, or the minigame teleport to the Nightmare Zone and walk south-west from there to [[Yanille]]. The bar is at the southwestern part of the city.
*The [[Rising Sun Inn]] - Teleport to Falador. The bar is south-west of the teleport spot.
*[[The Rusty Anchor]] - Use an [[amulet of glory]] to teleport to [[Draynor Village]] and walk west to Port Sarim, use the [[Rat Pits]] minigame teleport to get to [[Port Sarim]], use the [[Pest Control]] [[minigame teleport]] and run north and travel with the squire to get to Port Sarim, if your [[POH|house]] is in [[Rimmington]], teleport to house and run east to [[Port Sarim]], or simply walk south from Falador to Port Sarim and proceed to the most north-eastern building in Port Sarim.
*The [[Karamja Wines, Spirits, and Beers|Karamja Spirits Bar]]  -  Take a ship to [[Musa Point]] from Port Sarim or glory teleport to Karamja.
*Take the [[charter ship]] to [[Brimhaven]], take the boat from Rimmington or go to Musa Point and walk past the volcano, getting the drink from the [[Dead Man's Chest]].
*Return to the [[Barbarian Outpost]], preferably by using a games necklace.
}}

====Alternative routes====
=====Low magic/few teleports=====
{{Checklist|
*Run to the [[Tree Gnome Stronghold]], go to the {{FloorNumber|uk=1}} of the [[Grand Tree]], and get the drink from [[Blurberry Bar]].
*Go to Ardougne, then proceed to the [[Flying Horse Inn]], located in the western side of East Ardougne.
*Travel south to [[Yanille]]. Buy a drink from the bar at the south-western part of the city.
*Go to Varrock and visit the [[Blue Moon Inn]].
*Proceed north-east in Varrock to the [[Jolly Boar Inn]]. It is just west of the [[Lumber Yard]].
*Go to Falador and then go to the [[Rising Sun Inn]].
*Walk to [[Port Sarim]], and proceed to [[the Rusty Anchor]].
*Take the ship to [[Musa Point]] and visit the [[Karamja Wines, Spirits, and Beers|Karamja Spirits Bar]].
*Take the [[charter ship]] to [[Brimhaven]], or simply run west over the volcano, getting the drink from the [[Dead Man's Chest]].
*Now take the charter ship for 480 coins to Catherby then go to [[Seers' Village]], and then visit the [[Forester's Arms]].
*Return to the [[Barbarian Outpost]], preferably by using a games necklace.
}}

=====Low cost/low magic/shortest walking distances=====
Required:
*Extra coins for transportation
*A [[games necklace]]
*A [[Dramen staff]] or better for Fairy Ring teleportation
*Unlocked [[Balloon transport system]] to [[Falador]] and [[Varrock]]

{{Checklist|
* Start in [[Seers' Village]] (walk or teleport there), and visit the [[Forester's Arms]].
* Take the Sinclair Mansion fairy ring to [[Yanille]] ({{fairycode|ciq}}). Buy a drink from the bar at the south-western part of the city.
* Run back to the fairy ring, travel to the Grand Exchange ({{fairycode|dkr}}) and climb the [[Spirit Tree]] to the [[Tree Gnome Stronghold]], go to the {{FloorNumber|uk=1}} of the [[Grand Tree]], and get the drink from [[Blurberry Bar]].
* Climb the Spirit Tree again to the [[Khazard Battlefield]] and run north to the [[Flying Horse Inn]], located in the western side of East Ardougne.
* Take the ship to [[Brimhaven]], getting the drink from the [[Dead Man's Chest]].
* Walk to [[Musa Point]] and visit the [[Karamja Wines, Spirits, and Beers|Karamja Spirits Bar]].
* Take the ship to [[Port Sarim]], and proceed to [[the Rusty Anchor]].
* Run north (or teleport) to Falador and then go to the [[Rising Sun Inn]]. This is probably the longest distance to run after Seers' Village, you can consider to teleport.
* Run south (by first taking the Crumbling Wall on the West, or going underneath in the south) and take the [[balloon transport system|balloon]] to [[Varrock]] and walk to the [[Jolly Boar Inn]].
* Run south and visit the [[Blue Moon Inn]].
* Return to the [[Barbarian Outpost]], preferably by using a [[games necklace]].
}}

=====Utilising gnomes' transportation=====
Required:
*Extra coins for transportation
*Access to [[spirit tree]]s and [[gnome glider]]s
*Easy access to a [[spirit tree]] (e.g. [[Ardougne cloak]])

{{Checklist|
* Start in the [[Tree Gnome Stronghold]] and go to the {{FloorNumber|uk=1}} of the [[Grand Tree]] to get the drink from [[Blurberry Bar]].
* Take the [[gnome glider]] to [[Lemanto Andra]] and walk northwest to the [[Jolly Boar Inn]].
* Walk around to the [[Blue Moon Inn]] in South [[Varrock]].
* Take the spirit tree from the [[Grand Exchange]] to [[Khazard Battlefield]] to the [[Flying Horse Inn]].
* Take the [[charter ship]] to [[Brimhaven]] and get wasted at the [[Dead Man's Chest]].
* Run east to the [[Karamja Wines, Spirits, and Beers|Karamja Spirits Bar]] at [[Musa Point]].
** If you haven't done [[Pirate's Treasure]] yet, now's a good time to smuggle your [[Karamjan rum]] over.
* Take the ship to [[Port Sarim]] and go north to the [[Rusty Anchor Inn]].
* From then, go north into [[Falador]] and visit the [[Rising Sun Inn]].
* Take a spirit tree to [[Tree Gnome Village]] and leave the maze via [[Elkoy]]. Run south and then east to get to [[Yanille]]'s [[Dragon Inn]].
** Players who have access to the [[Nightmare Zone]] can use the minigame teleport instead, and also pop in and out of a practice instance to restore run energy.
* Take the charter ship from [[Port Khazard]], a little north east of Yanille, to [[Catherby]], and run to [[Seer's Village]] to visit the [[Forester's Arms]].
* Return to the [[Barbarian Outpost]], either by running west, using a [[Games Necklace]], or taking the minigame teleport to [[Barbarian Assault]].
}}

==Rewards==
Upon completion of the miniquest, players will now be able to access the [[Barbarian Outpost Agility Course]], which is required to enter during [[Scorpion Catcher]] and [[Horror from the Deep]]. In addition, players can speak to the [[barbarian guard]] to learn how to automatically smash empty vials upon drinking the last dose of a potion.

==Required for completing==
Completion of Alfred Grimhand's Barcrawl is required for the following:
* [[Horror from the Deep]]
* [[Medium Kandarin Diary]]
* [[Scorpion Catcher]]

==Trivia==
*After completing all bar crawl locations, you will be unable to read the bar crawl card as you will be "too drunk."
*After drinking in Brimhaven, it says you think you see two bartenders signing two barcrawl cards.
*After drinking at the Falador pub, your screen will sway slightly to indicate you are drunk.
*None of the drinks appear in a player's inventory but are drunk automatically.
*After you hand the bar crawl card to the guard, he says that he never learned to read, he just sees you are plenty drunk and lets you go to the agility course.
*It is possible to redo the miniquest by drop-tricking to make a duplicate and, before completing the quest, dropping it again. To start it again, the player must go to one of the bars; however, they will be unable to enter the agility course until they complete it again.

{{Alfred Grimhand's Barcrawl}}
{{Miniquests}}
